intro: Silene cucubalus subsp. vesicaria, commonly known as the bladder bladder, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It thrives in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Silene cucubalus subsp. vesicaria is typically found in temperate climates and is often associated with calcareous soils.
